alert.note: Alert for Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 6:18PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN WASHBURN AND SOUTHWESTERN SAWYER COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM CDT... At 618 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Birchwood, or 19 miles northeast of Rice Lake, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Birchwood, Winter, Radisson, Exeland, Couderay, Edgewater, Ojibwa, Sissabagama Lake, Deer Lake, Little Sissabagama Lake, and Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
